summary: Email chain between Paul Cassell and an unnamed recipient discussing potential T-visa assistance for a woman possibly connected to the Epstein case who is stuck in Toronto. The emails explore visa requirements and cooperation with law enforcement.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Attorney seeking T-visa assistance for a woman who may be an Epstein victim, communicating with another individual about options.

events.title: T-visa inquiry for potential Epstein victim
events.description: Paul Cassell emails seeking help to get a woman possibly connected to Epstein into the US on a T-visa, noting she is stuck in Toronto.

events.title: Follow-up on T-visa limitations
events.description: Response email clarifies that a T-visa is for staying in the US, not entering, and suggests cooperation with US law enforcement may provide options.

keyFacts: A woman possibly connected to the Epstein case is stuck in Toronto and seeking entry to the US via a T-visa.
Paul Cassell, an attorney, is assisting with the T-visa inquiry, indicating legal efforts to help potential victims.
The email clarifies that a T-visa is for staying in the US, not for entry, requiring cooperation with US law enforcement for potential solutions.
The woman's status as an Epstein victim is noted as not definitively established.
The case is described as 'stuck in limbo with referral to law-enforcement agencies.'
